page.title: 14Drainage System around Mark
page.content: The average height above sea level of the Somerset Moors is 17ft. and it can be as low as 7ft. in places. The {drainage system}has to cope with all the rainfall and the run-off from the surrounding hills. As hightides are sometimes 40ft. it is necessary that the sea walls are kept in good order (breaking occurred in Dec. 1982 with disasterous results in the Burnham and Huntspill areas). The first stage of the system is a network of{ditches}which also serve as fences to fields and are the responsibility of local farmers.This ditch system is linked to a system of {rhynes}which are larger and deeper than ditches and are the responsibility in Mark of the{Drainage {Boards}who levy a drainage rate on all householders in the area.Continued on Page 15.
